metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20812 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.4.7. The prb_calc_retire_blk_tmo() function in net/packet/af_packet.c can result in a denial of service (CPU consumption and soft lockup) in a certain failure case involving TPACKET_V3, aka CID-b43d1f9f7067.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20812` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-173-generic - 4.4.0-173.203
linux-image-4.4.0-173-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-173.203
linux-image-4.4.0-173-lowlatency - 4.4.0-173.203
linux-image-4.4.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-173.203
linux-image-4.4.0-173-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-173.203
linux-image-4.4.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-173.203
linux-image-4.4.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-173.203
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-173-generic - 4.4.0-173.203
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-173-lowlatency - 4.4.0-173.203
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-173.203').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1101.112').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1060.62~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1071.76').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1055.59').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-88.88~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1065.72').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1033.36~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1128.137').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-173.203').
linux-signed-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1060.62~16.04.1').

linux-signed-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-88.88~16.04.1').
linux-signed-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-signed-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1033.36~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1132.140').
